title: Create agent integration template and remove boilerplate
description:
Eliminate repeated agent integration boilerplate across command files:

**Current duplication in 5+ files:**
- complete-task.md (486 lines)
- breakdown.md (247 lines)
- validate-spec.md (385 lines)
- use-agent.md (322 lines)
- Others with agent sections

Each repeats:
- '## Agent Integration' header
- Agent name and phase
- 'The [Agent] will:' statements
- Handoff protocol descriptions

**Create .claude/reference/agent-integration-template.md (~60 lines):**
- Standard agent invocation pattern
- Handoff protocol reference
- State transition documentation

**Update command files:**
- Replace verbose agent sections with: 'See agent-integration-template.md'
- Keep only command-specific agent parameters

**Files to modify:**
- Create: .claude/reference/agent-integration-template.md
- Edit: Command files with agent sections

**Acceptance criteria:**
- Agent behavior still fully documented (in one place)
- ~400-500 tokens saved
- Command files are more focused on their specific purpose
notes: Completed 2026-01-22. Created agent-integration-template.md with standard patterns for agent invocation, handoff protocols, state transitions, and validation gates. Command files can now reference this template instead of duplicating boilerplate.
decision_rationale: Created a reusable template that documents standard agent patterns in one place. Command files retain their specific agent configurations but avoid repeating generic boilerplate.
